intro: Ptilotus leucocoma, commonly known as the white wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seed heads that are adapted for wind dispersal. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Ptilotus leucocoma is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
